January 24, 1955
Miss Marguerite Fleming, Chairman
NAEB School Program Planning Subcommittee
Radio Station KSLH
1517 South Theresa Avenue
St. Louis, Missouri
Dear Marguerites
Glad your reservation is acceptable. Ola will not arrive
until Thursday morning, February 10, at 9*50 or possibly 11*00 a.m.
Regarding the handbooks, I agree that something is wrong with
the way in which they are handled and that we should talk about the
problem. They are delivered to the stations, because they are sent out
with the order blanks. If a station orders & series, it must have re¬
ceived the handbook. If we have extra number of handbooks left over
after the offering, we keep them on hand for an indeterminate number of
months—in case a station writes for an extra copy. Off hand, I think
that the only thing we can do is to impress stations that they must
hang onto these books until they definitely know that they are through
with a series or are not going to us© it at all. But that*s an impromptu
idea—a repeat of your own suggestion—and perhaps we111 come up with
something else at our meeting.
Sincerely,
John R. Holt
_ Network Manager
